member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute
member.summary: Configures a callback service implementation in a client application.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Configures the binding elements to support the callback behavior.

The collection of binding parameters that are configured.

member.summary: Configures the client runtime to support the callback object.

The client run-time object that the attribute configures.

member.summary: Implementation of the method. This implementation has no effect.
member.param: The endpoint to be modified.
The endpoint dispatcher that the method modifies.

member.summary: Validates the endpoint description prior to building the runtime.
member.param: The endpoint to be validated.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.AutomaticSessionShutdown
member.summary: Specifies whether to automatically close a session when a service closes a duplex session.
member.returns: if duplex callback objects automatically close a session when the service closes a duplex session; otherwise, . The default is .

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.ConcurrencyMode
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a service supports one thread, multiple threads, or reentrant calls.
member.exception: The value is not one of the values.
member.returns: One of the values; the default is .

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.UseSynchronizationContext
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to use the current synchronization context to choose the thread of execution.
member.returns: if all calls to the service must run on the thread specified by the ; otherwise, . The default value is .

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.ConcurrencyMode
member.summary: Specifies whether a service class supports single-threaded or multi-threaded modes of operation.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.ConcurrencyMode.Multiple
member.summary: The service instance is multi-threaded. No synchronization guarantees are made. Because other threads can change your service object at any time, you must handle synchronization and state consistency at all times.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.ConcurrencyMode.Reentrant
member.summary: The service instance is single-threaded and accepts reentrant calls. The reentrant service accepts calls when you call another service; it is therefore your responsibility to leave your object state consistent before callouts and you must confirm that operation-local data is valid after callouts. Note that the service instance is unlocked only by calling another service over a WCF channel. In this case, the called service can reenter the first service via a callback. If the first service is not reentrant, the sequence of calls results in a deadlock. For details, see .

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.ConcurrencyMode.Single
member.summary: The service instance is single-threaded and does not accept reentrant calls. If the property is , and additional messages arrive while the instance services a call, these messages must wait until the service is available or until the messages time out.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.DuplexChannelFactory`1
member.summary: Provides the means to create and manage duplex channels of different types that are used by clients to send and receive messages to and from service endpoints.
